DeadDrow1_Dead.synopsis: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - one of the drow raiders. He was killed by a Flaming Fist archer perched atop the inn.

VB_DeadDrow1Armor.synopsis: Party comments on finding the armour of a dead drow in the tavern region.

VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow.synopsis: Party with drow in it comes upon a dead drow and comments on the armour. The second speaker is always a Dr

OxAlive_AD.synopsis: An ox caught in a stall near a burning inn. He is agitated, a dead goblin at  his feet. This AD plays if the player gets near but dialogue cannot be initiated (say, if they're polymorphed.)

DeadGoblin1_Dead.synopsis: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - one of the goblin raiders. He was killed chasing a child through the inn.

Sign_PAD.synopsis: The player is reading from a signpost in front of the tavern 'Waukeen's Rest'.

DeadCiv1_Dead.synopsis: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - a civilian that was caught in the middle. She stopped in Wakeen's Rest with her husband and daughter in the middle of their journey to Waterdeep for a wedding. She watched her family butchered by goblins before being killed herself.

DeadFF1_Dead.synopsis: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - a member of the Flaming Fist who was sworn to protect the Duke. She was among the final Fists left standing. She was killed guarding the Duke.

VB_House.synopsis: PC approaches tavern where Flaming Fists are trying to break through.

OxAlive.synopsis: An agitated ox, trapped in a stable near a burning inn. The inn was attacked by goblins and drow in the night. Players may try to calm him - if they fail, he attack.In his SwA version, he speaks like a human. He is initially in a state of terrified rage, barely able to form sentences. If he's pacified, he is calm and placid.The ox is standing in a stall, a dead goblin at his feet. When players arrive, he is agitated, ready to attack at a moment's notice. If calmed, he will relax and moo peacefully.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Upon analyzing the session descriptions, we notice that several sessions are clearly part of a narrative sequence. First, the arrival session (VB_Arrival) sets the stage as the PC approaches the raided town, and from there the player encounters the aftermath of the attack. The corpse dialogue sessions (DeadDrow1_Dead, DeadGoblin1_Dead, DeadCiv1_Dead, DeadFF1_Dead) are triggered after the arrival – they detail finding and speaking with dead characters at the ransacked inn. In addition, there is further commentary on the dead drow: two sessions (VB_DeadDrow1Armor and VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow) that both involve commentary on the drow corpse and its armor. Clearly, only one of these can occur depending on whether a drow is present in the party, meaning they are mutually exclusive. Similarly, there are two OxAlive sessions: OxAlive_AD (a non-interactable “ambient dialogue” version, triggered when certain conditions like polymorphing prevent proper interaction) and OxAlive (the standard interaction with the ox). Since these represent alternative versions of the same encounter, they are mutually exclusive based on player conditions. Another minor ordering is suggested by the Sign_PAD session, which is about reading a signpost in front of the tavern (Waukeen’s Rest). Since the tavern is approached as part of the unfolding events set up by VB_Arrival, one can infer that reading the sign precedes encountering the tavern action (VB_House). Thus, we introduce an order linking Sign_PAD and VB_House. Finally, VB_House (approaching the tavern with Flaming Fists attempting to break through) logically comes after the initial arrival but can be seen as a later event, as the PC navigates deeper into the crisis. Note that while many of these sessions occur in the same storyline region, only those with a clear cause–effect or mutually exclusive relationship are recorded as constraints.

DeadDrow1_Dead_0.speaker: Narrator
DeadDrow1_Dead_0.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

DeadDrow1_Dead_1.speaker: Dead Drow Raider
DeadDrow1_Dead_1.context: NodeContext: Pronounced 'SHA-muhth'. Emphasis on the SHA.

DeadDrow1_Dead_5.speaker: Player
DeadDrow1_Dead_5.text: Why were you at the inn?

DeadDrow1_Dead_18.speaker: Player
DeadDrow1_Dead_18.text: What were you trying to retrieve?

DeadDrow1_Dead_16.speaker: Player
DeadDrow1_Dead_16.text: Where were you trying to take the Duke?

DeadDrow1_Dead_26.speaker: Narrator
DeadDrow1_Dead_26.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

DeadDrow1_Dead_30.speaker: Narrator
DeadDrow1_Dead_30.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

VB_DeadDrow1Armor_1.speaker: Player
VB_DeadDrow1Armor_1.text: Drowcraft armour. No magic left, though - sun's too bright.

VB_DeadDrow1Armor_2.speaker: Player
VB_DeadDrow1Armor_2.text: Excellent armour - strange place to find it.

VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow_2.speaker: Player
VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow_2.text: Not much magic left, though - sun's too bright.

VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow_1.speaker: Player
VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow_1.text: An unlikely place for such a fortunate find.

DeadGoblin1_Dead_21.speaker: Player
DeadGoblin1_Dead_21.text: What were you doing at the inn?

DeadGoblin1_Dead_3.speaker: Player
DeadGoblin1_Dead_3.text: Why did you target the inn?

DeadGoblin1_Dead_19.speaker: Dead Goblin Raider
DeadGoblin1_Dead_19.text: Kidnap... the Duke... for the Absolute...

DeadGoblin1_Dead_10.speaker: Player
DeadGoblin1_Dead_10.text: Where were you trying to take the Duke?

DeadGoblin1_Dead_23.speaker: Player
DeadGoblin1_Dead_23.text: Why were you after the Duke?

DeadGoblin1_Dead_9.speaker: Narrator
DeadGoblin1_Dead_9.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

DeadGoblin1_Dead_6.speaker: Narrator
DeadGoblin1_Dead_6.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

DeadGoblin1_Dead_17.speaker: Narrator
DeadGoblin1_Dead_17.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Sign_PAD_0.speaker: Player
Sign_PAD_0.text:
'Welcome to Waukeen's Rest.
West - Baldur's Gate. East - Elturel.'
Sign_PAD_0.context: NodeContext: The player is reading from a signpost. Pronunciation: Wah-KEEN, ELL-tur-ELL

DeadCiv1_Dead_49.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_49.text: What's wrong with you? Let her go!
DeadCiv1_Dead_49.context: NodeContext: Benryn feels like the player is desecrating his wife's corpse.

DeadCiv1_Dead_60.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_60.text: You're a medium! You're going to speak to her.

DeadCiv1_Dead_63.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_63.text: Could you ask her something for me?

DeadCiv1_Dead_59.speaker: Player
DeadCiv1_Dead_59.text: I can't. She won't answer any more questions.

DeadCiv1_Dead_24.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_24.text: Oh. It was probably pointless anyway.

DeadCiv1_Dead_65.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_65.text: I'd hoped she could tell us where she took the dowry.
DeadCiv1_Dead_65.context: NodeContext: Sighs before the line. He's resigned, explaining something he knows doesn't matter.

DeadCiv1_Dead_42.speaker: Player
DeadCiv1_Dead_42.text: I'll look around. Any idea where it's stashed?

DeadCiv1_Dead_26.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_26.text: She didn't make it far. It'll be close.

DeadCiv1_Dead_54.speaker: Player
DeadCiv1_Dead_54.text: Stop worrying about the dowry. It's gone.

DeadCiv1_Dead_61.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_61.text: No, you're right. Those monsters could've taken it.

DeadCiv1_Dead_21.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_21.text: She had her sister's dowry. I'd hoped she could tell us where it is.
DeadCiv1_Dead_21.context: NodeContext: Sighs before the line. He's resigned, explaining something he knows doesn't matter.

DeadCiv1_Dead_2.speaker: Player
DeadCiv1_Dead_2.text: Maybe. What do you want me to ask?

DeadCiv1_Dead_38.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_38.text: The dowry. She'd know where it is.
DeadCiv1_Dead_38.context: NodeContext: Having an 'aha' moment (but not excited - he's still grieving)

DeadCiv1_Dead_1.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_1.text: It's for her sister's wedding. Miri had it when she ran out.

DeadCiv1_Dead_67.speaker: Player
DeadCiv1_Dead_67.text: This dowry? I'm keeping it as payment for saving your life.

DeadCiv1_Dead_69.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_69.text: Fine. I hope you choke on it.

DeadCiv1_Dead_57.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_57.text: Let her go. And go to hell.

DeadCiv1_Dead_34.speaker: Player
DeadCiv1_Dead_34.text: I already found it. Here, take it. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

DeadCiv1_Dead_51.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_51.text: I know this doesn't change anything, but it helps. Thank you.

DeadCiv1_Dead_19.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_19.text: You can stop now. Let her rest.

DeadCiv1_Dead_3.speaker: Player
DeadCiv1_Dead_3.text: I already know where it is.

DeadCiv1_Dead_17.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_17.text: I trust you to get it for me. I can't leave her.

DeadCiv1_Dead_33.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_33.text: The barn? She must mean one of the empty buildings behind the inn.

DeadCiv1_Dead_36.speaker: Player
DeadCiv1_Dead_36.text: Be quiet. I have questions of my own.

DeadCiv1_Dead_22.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead_22.text: Please, leave her be. She deserves peace.

DeadCiv1_Dead_64.speaker: Player
DeadCiv1_Dead_64.text: Why were you at the inn?

DeadCiv1_Dead_58.speaker: Player
DeadCiv1_Dead_58.text: Did you have any valuables nearby?

DeadCiv1_Dead_13.speaker: Narrator
DeadCiv1_Dead_13.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

DeadCiv1_Dead_14.speaker: Narrator
DeadCiv1_Dead_14.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

DeadFF1_Dead_6.speaker: Narrator
DeadFF1_Dead_6.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

DeadFF1_Dead_16.speaker: Flaming Fist Mercenary
DeadFF1_Dead_16.text: ... drow... goblins... had one... in my sights... then darkness...

DeadFF1_Dead_3.speaker: Player
DeadFF1_Dead_3.text: Why were you at the inn?

DeadFF1_Dead_4.speaker: Narrator
DeadFF1_Dead_4.text: *The corpse remains silent. She doesn't know.*

DeadFF1_Dead_17.speaker: Player
DeadFF1_Dead_17.text: Do you know of any survivors?

DeadFF1_Dead_0.speaker: Narrator
DeadFF1_Dead_0.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

VB_House_0.speaker: Player
VB_House_0.text: I hear shouting. Someone needs help.

OxAlive_8.speaker: Frightened Ox
OxAlive_8.text: Hm. You're not one of them.

OxAlive_15.speaker: Narrator
OxAlive_15.text: *The creature turns a piece of cud around its mouth, chewing contentedly.*

OxAlive_44.speaker: Frightened Ox
OxAlive_44.context: NodeContext: Taking deep, scared breaths, speaking on the exhale.

OxAlive_50.speaker: Player
OxAlive_50.text: Look at me - I'm not a monster.

OxAlive_58.speaker: Frightened Ox
OxAlive_58.text: No... you're not. They were small like you, but uglier.
OxAlive_58.context: NodeContext: Slightly out of breath - calming down

OxAlive_45.speaker: Frightened Ox
OxAlive_45.text: No. You're not one of them at all.
OxAlive_45.context: NodeContext: Slightly out of breath - calming down

OxAlive_64.speaker: Frightened Ox
OxAlive_64.text: I was ready to run you through. My mistake, friend.

OxAlive_63.speaker: Player
OxAlive_63.text: It's all right. What happened here?

OxAlive_21.speaker: Frightened Ox
OxAlive_21.text: An attack. Monsters... little ones, and taller ones.
OxAlive_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks to the dead goblin - camera follows

OxAlive_4.speaker: Frightened Ox
OxAlive_4.text: They took the shiny one. He killed many.

OxAlive_18.speaker: Player
OxAlive_18.text: Did you kill the goblin in the stable?

OxAlive_41.speaker: Frightened Ox
OxAlive_41.text: Yes. It was screaming, waving around its metal.

OxAlive_5.speaker: Player
OxAlive_5.text: Do you know the dead ox outside?

OxAlive_48.speaker: Frightened Ox
OxAlive_48.text: Him? He was the biggest. Now I'm the biggest.

OxAlive_1.speaker: Player
OxAlive_1.text: Stay back. I don't want to hurt you, but I will.

OxAlive_51.speaker: Frightened Ox
OxAlive_51.text: You'd give me a choice? Hm. You're not like them.
OxAlive_51.context: NodeContext: Slightly out of breath - calming down

OxAlive_10.speaker: Player
OxAlive_10.text: Calm, friend. I won't harm you.

OxAlive_40.speaker: Frightened Ox
OxAlive_40.text: You speak to me? The monsters only scream.
OxAlive_40.context: NodeContext: Slightly out of breath - calming down

OxAlive_47.speaker: Frightened Ox
OxAlive_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Front hoof clawing at the ground, ready to charge.

OxAlive_55.speaker: Narrator
OxAlive_55.text: *The ox tenses, horns lowered in your direction.*

OxAlive_52.speaker: Narrator
OxAlive_52.text: *His hide twitches, every muscle primed to bolt. He's terrified.*

OxAlive_53.speaker: Player
OxAlive_53.text: Square your stance and face him directly.

OxAlive_46.speaker: Player
OxAlive_46.text: Stare him down, as you have so many beasts in the wild.

OxAlive_34.speaker: Narrator
OxAlive_34.text: *He huffs and, after a moment, appears to relax.*

OxAlive_42.speaker: Narrator
OxAlive_42.text: *The ox calms, his tail swishing a satisfied arc.*

OxAlive_49.speaker: Narrator
OxAlive_49.text: *You manage only to agitate him more.*

OxAlive_27.speaker: Narrator
OxAlive_27.text: *His glassy eyes roll, wild with fear, as he begins to charge.*

OxAlive_22.speaker: Narrator
OxAlive_22.text: *You gather nothing from his intense stare.*
